metadata.title: CVE-2022-1205 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s AmateurRadio AX.25 protocol functionality in the way a user connects with theprotocol. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1009.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-azure - 5.15.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1019-azure-fde - 5.15.0-1008.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1006-gcp - 5.15.0-1006.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1006-gke - 5.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1001-gkeop - 5.15.0-1001.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-ibm - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1007-oracle - 5.15.0-1007.9
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1011-raspi - 5.15.0-1011.13
linux-image-5.15.0-1011-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1011.13
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-lowlatency - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1011-oem - 5.17.0-1011.12
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1008.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-35.36').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.8').
linux-aws package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1009.11').
linux-azure package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.9').
linux-azure-fde package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.9').
linux-gcp package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1006.9').
linux-gke package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1006.7').
linux-gkeop package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1001.2').
linux-ibm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-oracle package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1007.9').
linux-raspi package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1011.13').
linux-lowlatency package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-35.36').
linux-oem-5.17 package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.17.0-1011.12').
linux-intel-iotg package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1008.11').
linux-oem-6.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-oem-6.1, was needs-triage').
